newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Prime buys regional TV licence.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Prime buys regional TV licence.

text.p: Prime Television Ltd said on Tuesday it had purchased the licence to operate a second free to air television service in the Mildura region of Victoria for A$3.2 million.
The licence was offered for sale through an auction process conducted by the Australian Broadcasting Authority (ABA).
The Mildura licence and a second licence for Darwin, were the first free to air television licences to be offered in Australia for many years, and the first to be offered at auction, Prime said.
Prime Television was among the underbidders on the Darwin licence, which sold for A$2.1 million to Telecasters Australia Ltd.

Prime said it expected to be on air in Mildura in mid-1997. Programming sourced from the Seven Network Ltd, with which Prime Television has an affiliation agreement, would form the basis of the new service, Prime said.
